page.title: 18Daily Life for a Young Mum.
page.content: The day starts at about 7.00a.m. with the first noises from the toddler's cot.The trick is to have the rest of the family dressed and ready before the toddler gets up, otherwise chaos reigns and everybody is late.At 9.30a.m. the washing machine engineer arrives and it emerges that we use our washing machine three times as often as the average. That is why it is prematurely aged.Time to dash to the mobile clinic where the toddler is weighed and smiles through his injection.I beam proudly, then he screams.After lunch and a peaceful rest we collect big sister from school and drive the seven miles to the supermarket.The toddler sits in the trolley and,smiling again, behaves appallingly.Everyone smiles back, proving that the British like children. Home for supper,baths and bed.On a good day,all is quiet by7.00p.m.
